alert.note: Alert for East Platte County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 3:51PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Goshen and east central Platte Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 351 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Grayrocks Reservoir, or 14 miles northeast of Wheatland, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Laramie, Grayrocks Reservoir and Fort Laramie National Historic Site. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
